intro: Colymbada incana, commonly known as the silky bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has hairy, grayish stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Colymbada incana is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
